meanings.definition: Suffering from a fever or shivering fit.
meanings.sent1: The agued child was wrapped in a warm blanket.
meanings.sent2: She felt agued and had to stay in bed all day.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked agued after playing in the snow.
meanings.sent4: The old house had an agued, shivering feel to it.
meanings.sent5: The agued trees swayed in the cold wind.

meanings.definition: To have a fever or shivering fit.
meanings.sent1: He agued all night, unable to sleep due to the fever.
meanings.sent2: The hiker agued as he climbed the icy mountain.
meanings.sent3: The engine agued and sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: Her heart agued with fear as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The storm agued on, relentless in its fury.
